reviews.reviewTitle: Don't buy, will rust in a year.
reviews.reviewText: I boil water about 2 times a week for tea. We got this kettle, and dry it out the best we can after every use. It traps a little bit of water in it that is hard to get out. After a while the cracks in the bottom started to rust. 1 year and a few weeks after buying the kettle I called KitchenAid to see what to do because I was worried about drinking water out of a rusty kettle. All they told me is to throw it away and then they tried to sell me a new one. If you buy a kettle from KitchenAid you will be having to buy a new one every year. Then when I said I didn't want to buy a new one if it will just rust on me, they just said sorry and ended to chat on me.

I have had this kettle for about 9 month now and I am very satisfied with my purchase. A few reviews were not as great and I was very hesitant to order. It seemed that some people had rust problems after a few month. I leave the lid open to ensure that the moisture can escape after boiling water and I never leave any water in it. The hot kettle dries that way pretty quick and it prevents the rust.
It is a smaller kettle and I would say it works perfect for 1-2 people servings. The size is definitely to small for a whole family of tea drinkers :)

Update: I am still satisfied with my purchase. The kettle still works and looks like on day one after three years of use. The second picture of the inside is the most recent picture taken. I use it at least once a day.
Terrible! Had it for 5 months and the lid has rusted! Looks awful!

I usually do not write reviews on Amazon but I was compelled to write this one because there are so many confusing reviews about this product out there. If you are looking for a plastic free electric kettle like me, this is not for you. There are 4 plastic parts inside the pot. ( see pics )
1. Filter - removable
2. Bigger plastic piece that holds the filter - NOT removable and it comes in contact with water. I live-chatted with customer service and this is their response.
"Thank you for waiting. That plastic piece that holds the filter is not removable."
3. Rivet from handle - above the max water level
4. 2 rivets inside of lid
I gave 3 stars because it is very stylish and I am sure it works really well, I know because I own several KitchenAid appliances as you can see the built-in KitchenAid oven on my picture background. But sorry I am disappointed and returning this one.

reviews.reviewTitle: Purchased this product in Nov 2016, and it's no ...
reviews.reviewText: Purchased this product in Nov 2016, and it's no longer working after 5 months. I have to push down the kettle to make it connect with the base, and that only works sometimes...

reviews.reviewTitle: Excellent ergonomics and no-frills, classic design
reviews.reviewText:
I previously reviewed a different kettle made by Kitchenaid (KitchenAid KEK1722SX 1.7-Liter Electric Kettle with LED Display - Brushed Stainless Steel) and find that this one is equally nice, but for different reasons. This model is slightly smaller, has fewer features (like electronic temp display, stay-warm function, etc), but it also boils water faster, has a nicer spout and handle, and has a unique, old-fashioned design that will look great on any counter. Below I will go into slightly more depth about its features, always trying to compare it to the other Kitchenaid kettle, which is now at about the same price point. BE SURE TO CHECK OUT MY PICS FOR MORE EXPLANATION OF FEATURES.

►' When I first opened the package, my very first thought is that this kettle looks better than the 1.7 liter KitchenAid. But the design is functional as well as pretty. The curved handle is made of very thick, well formed stainless steel and does not cut into fingers; it actually feels really nice in the hand. The spout, too, pours better than the 1.7L owing to the full cylindrical design. The lid is very solidly made, but also comes off without too much struggle (unlike some others of this design that I've used). The on/off switch is beautiful (see my pic) if that is possible. And the shape of the kettle itself is very nice and ensures maximum capacity despite taking up little space. Overall I give ergonomics the highest possible rating for this kettle. Outstanding!

'► This kettle can heat a full pot of 1.25L in just under 5 minutes, making it slightly faster than the 1.7L KitchenAid (which took about 8 minutes to boil 1.7L). Obviously the time will vary depending on the temp of your tap water and inside air temperature. I think the faster boil time of the 1.25L is a result of the heating unit design (exposed instead of under bottom), which maximizes contact with the water. This does make it a bit louder, however (although not too bad).

'► The top opening of the 1.25L is super big and can probably fit all but the very biggest hands. This makes it very easy to clean. Well done, Kitchenaid!

►' I have months and months of hard use with the removable scale filter and I'm a big fan. Yes, it does contain plastic, but it's a minimal amount, and the scale filter really does work. It also lasts a long time. Where we live, given the high lime content of tap water, I would much rather have a scale filter with a tiny bit of plastic than be drinking huge amounts of lime flakes every time I make a cup of tea. If you don't like it, you could probably remove the whole thing from the inside (even if that meant damaging the filter parts beyond repair).

'► The cord is nice. It's actually designed to wrap/unwrap around the bottom, so you can let out lots of cord for a long reach, or wrap it up once or twice to keep the cord from cluttering your counter. Nice touch.

'► Be warned that the kettle is NOT insulated and will get very hot to the touch. This is pretty standard for kettles and not a complaint of mine, but if you were looking for an insulated one, keep looking.

Overall this is a very nice kettle and wins big points for having great ergonomics and a solid, no-frills design. It lacks the features of the 1.7L KitchenAid kettle I already owned, such as the ability to heat to certain temperatures, the temp readout, and the stay-warm feature. But it makes up for this with a very good design. Because it has so few electronics, I expect this to be the kind of kettle that lasts forever and just keeps on working and working and working. It will be the new kettle in my office. I'm sure my college students will comment on how cool it is!
kettle went rusty inside after 2 weeks of use
It got rusty inside only after one week.

I bought it because I love the KitchenAid brand. This was a great little kettle for the two months that it was operational. When it randomly broke, I requested a refund from KitchenAid but they have yet to get back to me. Poor customer service and the fact that the kettle isn't durable are why I give this a 1-star review.

reviews.reviewTitle: After about a year and a half of light use ...
reviews.reviewText: After about a year and a half of light use this already stop working... disappointing I have a cheap Chinese made one at 1/4 of the price at work that still work. I bought this one to replace that one at home... and of course the warranty only last one year...
thought I was buying an all stainless product, for clean water; nope, they put plastic inside. bummer

reviews.reviewTitle: Broke in less than 4 months of very infrequent use
reviews.reviewText: I bought this in March 2018. The on switch is already broken and the unit no longer working. Really surprised at the shoddy quality. I have not contacted KitchenAid to see about a replacement, but I don't think stellar customer service is going to make me likely to purchase a similar product from them again. I used this one evening just fine and the next day it stopped working. Was not dropped or potentially damaged in any way. I probably used this 2-3 times a week in my home, so wasn't normal wear and tear.

I was looking for a kettle with no plastic and this was nearly it. Its definitely the best I could find so far.

There is a peice of plastic inside that holds a filter. I don't care about the filter, so I just broke it and pulled it out. So now my water is not boiling with plastic in it all the time.

I wish it was a little easier to clean. I may end up just getting an induction burner and a normal iron kettle in the future. Not sure why so many companies are putting out cancer plastic and non stick in all their products. I'd pay more money for something simple and safe.

reviews.reviewTitle: The worst thing about this kettle though is that now after ...
reviews.reviewText: It heated up water quickly, but the other brand kettle we had before this one did too. The lid on this kettle is a major drawback, I prefer the flip style lid on our old kettle. The worst thing about this kettle though is that now after only 6 months of use I'm needing to replace it. We've been smelling something electrical the last two days when using it and today the pin in the center of the plug on the bottom of the kettle broke off. It looks like it bubbled and melted. Love my KitchenAid mixer that I've had for 24 years but this kettle is history!

reviews.reviewTitle: This kettle creates a horrible chemical smell and taste in the water
reviews.reviewText: This kettle creates a horrible chemical smell and taste in the water, even after washing and many weeks of use. The smell and tase have not gone away; in fact, they seem to have gotten worse over time. When I smell the bottom of the kettle, the odor is particularly strong. It seems to be coming from the plastic part in the middle of the kettle. I normally love KitchenAid products but for this one, I am hoping to get my money back.

reviews.reviewTitle: GOT CAUGHT BY THE DESIGN FIRST
reviews.reviewText: This is a simple but elegant design, with technical details that are very appealing. Base allows the cord to be stored so it's an appropriate length, kettle can sit down any way within the circle of the base without fumbling around. On switch is nice and simple, and auto-off is a big help - I have melted the last two kettles on my gas stove due to lack of attention. And, the color choice seemed especially lovely.

reviews.reviewTitle: Love this Kettle like a Hobbit Loves Second Breakfast.
reviews.reviewText:
uhh... seriously this is one of the cutest, awesome working, easy kettles i've ever had, hands down my absolute fav of all time... and I'm nearly 50:)
I don't have anything really technical to say about it. its a qualtiy product. use is intuitive. I could easily keep this one for the rest of my days. and barring any unforseen weird malfunction, I would buy another one to replace...just a great all around product.
I would definitely recommend as a gift. there is a wide color assortment too.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not a good kettle. Bad features.
reviews.reviewText:
We are frequent kettle users - for daily tea, making soups and sauces, oatmeal, etc. After our long time (not fancy) kettle broke we looked for an upgrade. This was not it! There are just a couple really badly designed features about this kettle that are deal breakers for me. I wish I would have done more research or thought about why I loved the old kettle, before I made a decision for a new one.

Specifically:
1. The top comes off completely, it does not "pop up." So, to fill it up you need to take the lid off entirely. this is itself isn't a deal breaker but it's not a good user experience, particularly because the handle goes across the opening which makes it even harder to fill up.
2. There is no water line to indicate how much water is in there. You have no idea how full or empty it is unless you look inside (and estimate) or until you pour it out at the end and realize you boiled too little.
3. Probably the worst, it gets VERY hot. This is not a good kettle to be around children. It feels like a hot pan on a stove as soon as it's boiled. I have not had this experience with other kettles.

Basically, it may look cute, but this kettle is not well designed or practical, at least for a frequent water boiler. Returning and going to get my old model (although not as cute).

This kettle is compact, but holds plenty of water. It looks to be high quality and is very attractive on my countertop. I'm so glad that I got this kettle. I wrestled with getting the Kitchenaid kettle with temperature control, but that one had plastic in the interior. This kettle has no plastics, except for a removable filter. I expect that this one will not leak, as there's no plastic window or extraneous seams.

reviews.reviewTitle: I love it! We are tea drinkers
reviews.reviewText: I love it! We are tea drinkers. However in the past I would use the stove top kettle to heat water for instant coffe or other hot water needs. On several instances we would not hear the tea kettle “whistle” and it would boil and boil. One day it boiled down to nothing and the handle started melting. This was a safety issue. Yes we paid more attention to when we turned it on but we realized that it could happen again. We got this electric beautiful (blue to match my kitchen decor) just right size teapot. I chose kitchen aid because of the brand name I trusted for past appliances and because of the reviews, the “automatic shut off” was of most importance. No more worries about a possible kitchen fire. The exterior is easy to clean just by little soap and water. The interior after a few months is just as smooth and shiny with no corrosion I have just rinsed it out. I have no idea what some of the reviews said about plastic parts it looks like only stainless steel and or aluminum. The base has the cord that you plug into the wall in the center is a raised plug that fits into a hole in the bottom of the kettle when you place it there. If you want hot water you press a button (on side of kettle) which turns green indicating its on and within a minute you hear water heating up and a few more minutes it shuts itself off. The top pouring handle stays cool and the lid stays firmly on while pouring. It’s perfect. I highly recommend this classy looking and Safe kettle.

I almost didn't get this kettle because it's not as large as I would prefer, but it's *so* cute that I kept coming back to it. So far I've been quite happy with this. It heats up quite quickly, even when the water is fresh out of the cold tap, in the dead of winter in the northeast; and believe me, that water is COLD. The handle stays cool to the touch, and the kettle is easy to lift because it's easy to find a good balance point on the handle, something which can be a real issue with larger electric kettles we've had. As with any kettle, you need to make sure that you keep your hand back from the mouth of the kettle when you take the lid off, and that you open it away from you (i.e., open the side closest to the spout, with your hand on the other side when holding the kettle to refill it when it's hot). Our last kettle didn't allow us to turn it on right away after emptying and refilling it for some reason, but this one has given us no difficulty with that. If you want to get every last drop out, you do need to tip it way over, which is a little bit of a nuisance.

Time will tell how well this holds up. The original kettle, a GE, lasted a good quarter century; but none of the others has come close to that.

The cord, BTW, is the same length as that on the one which died, which was just as long as the one before, etc., despite the fact that they were different brands (except that we had two Cuisinarts along the way). You just need to unwind some from under the base. This is set by law as a "safety" feature. I agree that it's barely long enough to be useable, but it's meant to keep people from tripping over the cord if you use it somewhere other than a countertop.
After 1 month my kettle totally burnt out and melted on the bottom, very very dangerous

reviews.reviewTitle: I would buy this pot again. Love it!
reviews.reviewText:
I use this kettle a few times a day. It heats faster than my stove kettle and has a small footprint. It has a filter to keep any hard water sediment out of your tea. I rinse the filter every 3-4 days because we have very hard water. Water stays pretty hot if you drink your tea fast or want an immediate warm up. The longest I have waited and poured more water without reheating is about 20 minutes. The button not only lights up, but you can also hear it click off so you don't have to stand there waiting. This pot has made my morning easier, has saved me the occasional splash burn that my Le Creuset pot was causing.
If I had my way the max fill level would be easier to see. It is half way up the side of the pot. When you look at this pot from the outside it seems like it would hold more water. It suits close to three cups if you are using a larger mug or cup.

reviews.reviewTitle: Nice, quiet, and quick kettle that’s perfect for my coffee brewing needs
reviews.reviewText:
I have had other kettles for some time but this is a great kettle worth the extra money that I spent. It heats up the water quickly, is very quiet compared to my older and cheaper kettles, and still allows me to use my smart plug to begin boiling the water just before I get to the kitchen. I use bottled water, so I have not had to clean it all the time I’ve used it. I fill it the night before and then empty it after pouring it over my fresh burr ground coffee beans. The hot kettle dries it out and because I use bottled water, there are no water marks or calcium or lime marks. It still looks brand new.

This is now my favorite kettle and I would buy it as a gift if I knew someone needed a kettle.

Love the appearance and light green color. Heats water fast. Generous capacity, Wish it had a smaller footprint, like my friend's Krups electric kettle, but some time I'll be glad to have the bigger capacity. After we use the hot water we empty it of any residual water, so it dries out inside between uses. (Once I made the mistake of taking the lid off, and almost scalded my hand on the steam.) I hope this will alleviate the problem that some cited, of rust developing inside the kettle (why isn't it rust-proof stainless steel?). We use filtered water, so maybe this won't be a problem. We pulled out the plastic filter, but the plastic frame remains, The cord is very short (16"), which isn't a problem where I'm keeping it, but it will really limit where you can put the thing on your kitchen counter (I think it should be 3 or 4 inches longer).

reviews.reviewTitle: Holds up well to constant use
reviews.reviewText: I've had this kettle for almost two years and use it several times a day. I don't empty the kettle between uses so it always has water in it but I've never had any issues with rust. I have only had to remove and rinse off the filter once in all that time. I love that the handle never gets hot, water boils quickly, and the kettle takes up very little counter space. All that and it's so cute!

This tea kettle is perfect! Right size, heats water quickly and quietly, stainless steel with removable filter...and a timeless design. Fits my retro 1940 kitchen perfectly. It's a good size to hold plenty of water with a small footprint too. And as with all Kitchenaid appliances, I'm sure it will be bulletproof. I've had my stand mixer and toaster for over 10 years with no issues and they still look brand new too.

Needed to replace our older Kitchen Aid electric kettle and went with this instead of the digital one we had previously.
LOVE IT !
It's easier to clean and takes up less space than the older digital model .
We use this multiple times a day and it's perfect!
I have all Kitchen Aid 'empire red ' in my kitchen and I have noticed the newer empire red products appear to be a brighter red but they all blend really well and this was no exception .

Really beautiful and matches my kitchenaid mixer. Slightly smaller than expected but works great. Only one small thing - this kettle seems sturdy and well made. Lots of stainless steel - except for the little lever you push down to start the kettle. Its silver colored plastic. I'm not entirely sure it's going to last long. Seemed odd, since the rest of the kettle is so well made. But I'm overall pleased with my purchase.
UPDATE: I've had this for 9 months now and the little plastic lever is holding up fine. Also, this is shockingly easy to clean. Just wipe out any hard water residue inside. Comes right off.

reviews.reviewTitle: Pretty, but not a time-saving replacement for a stove-top kettle.
reviews.reviewText: We traveled in England recently, and every Airbnb we stayed in had an electric kettle - they were universally quick to boil water - almost instant, really - so I decided to purchase one when I returned home. After looking at several cheaper options, I went with the KitchenAid: I liked the compact size, design and color, and thought the extra money (x2) for the KitchenAid brand meant a better product. Unfortunately it's not at all quick - even when only 1/2 or 1/3 full, it takes a long time to bring to a boil - I should have kept my stove-top kettle, and regret my expensive choice. Naturally, I'd already recycled the packaging so can't even return it for a better item. It's pretty, but overall very disappointing.

It seems like a really nice kettle but it was a gift and the color was the most important aspect. I paid a lot of extra money to get the deep navy blue. Even on the box the color was great, but when we pulled the kettle out the actual color is extremely flat and much lighter, almost lavender. It doesn't look so bad in the picture but IRL it's really far off, like flat paint instead of the glossy deep ceramic look of the photos. With so many kettles available the price was just silly ($80 for the blue version), I got a comparable one for myself elsewhere for $30 and it has worked great for years.

reviews.reviewTitle: Heats quickly, Easy to use & clean
reviews.reviewText: We use this all the time for anything requiring boiling water. And, our teenagers use it for water for instant oatmeal or ramen noodles on the go. Heats up super fast. Solid, made of quality materials. At first I was emptying it everyday and making sure it was dry because another reviewer complained of rust. However, what I think they may have mistaken is that the metal darkens when heated. I always leave the water in it and have had it for several months... no rust! Excellent product, highly recommend.

This is a great kettle. The only reason I gave it 4 stars is that the handle is not hinged and putting the top off and on sometimes causes drips on the counter. It also makes it more difficult to clean. Minor, but if the handle could be moved out of the way it would be quite perfect.

I had one of these products years ago I was very pleased with it I am also very pleased with this product being very lightweight metal designing and it heats up very quickly and performs exactly as I needed very satisfied I recommend this product if you're looking to make instant ramen soup hot tea hot cocoa anything where you would need just hot water quickly I recommend this product it heats up hot water within three to four minutes to boiling point

reviews.reviewTitle: Good buy - long time kettle user.
reviews.reviewText:
My husband is the tea drinker and was looking for a kettle that had a larger opening in order to clean inside. This one finally fits the bill.

We've used electric kettles for ages because of their convenience and speed. This one does not disappoint.

Sturdy and good base compared to lighter cheaper models.

reviews.reviewTitle: Love it. Too bad the cord / plug is so fat.
reviews.reviewText:
Have had this for nearly a year, I think... This gets used multiple times a day, every day. Love it. Good looking and works great.

I do wish that it had a flat plug... since it's going to be on a counter all the time, and it's got this big thick cord and fat plug, it makes it a little ugly and unwieldy looking. But oh well.

Just saw the comments about rusting. Going to check it out now. Ours always has water in it, we've never worried about it. Looked inside, checked it out, no rust.

reviews.reviewTitle: A bit disappointing, but it does its job
reviews.reviewText:
For the price, it didn't even occur to me that this would be single-wall steel. As a result, the exterior gets *very* hot. I saw in other reviews that there some plastic on the inside, but I was willing to accept that it's very difficult to find plastic-free electric kettles. But I really so no reason that a well-designed kettle in this price range should not be double-wall. In addition, my previous kettles heated their full pots in 2 minutes or less, not the 4 minutes this one takes.

All that to say that while the kettle functions as it should, I'm a little disappointed. It does not measure up to my Hamilton Beach, which cost about the same price.

Fell in love with this, but sadly had to return it as it wasn't quite the right shade of Red that I was looking for to go with everything else in my kitchen, otherwise a beautiful and very stylish kettle, and I love Kitchen Aid's products. So yes, I would most definitely recommend this.

This is a pretty kettle if you intend to leave it out and like to make a few cups of tea or coffee at a time. It is not as convenient to use as must other electric kettles due to the old-school plug lid, odd pouring angle, and relatively lower water capacity. It does heat up fast and the construction seems mostly solid, KitchenAid quality. You can pick up the kettle after boiling without an oven mitt, but it can get warm. If you use electric kettles for making food, or other high-volume applications, this might not be for you. Otherwise, it's a perfectly functional and aesthetically pleasing kettle.

reviews.reviewTitle: ) We are very happy with it and hope it lasts
reviews.reviewText:
This kettle is replacing a Cuisinart that failed after I ran a little of water on the outside of the pot. It seems the lever assembly is very sensitive and a little water seems to cause a little corrosion and disables the on/off switch. This kettle has the same system so I am very careful to turn the water on only after the faucet is over the opening.

There is no plastic smell as I've had with other kettles (even those which were virtually solid stainless.)

We are very happy with it and hope it lasts.

I hadn’t ever had an electric kettle before so didn’t know what I was missing! I drink hot tea all winter long, including when working from home. It is great! The water heats up very quickly and the shuts off automatically, a lot better than leaving hot water to boil on the stove and forgetting about it while on a conference call. I love the design and the bright blue color looks great on the countertop and matches my kitchen aid mixer. I thought the price was a bit high, but worth every penny

reviews.reviewTitle: Rusted after a year and a half of daily use.
reviews.reviewText: Buy this product if you are okay with it rusting in a year and a half after daily use. I contacted the company and received no reply yet.

I think this is a great little kettle. It heats water quickly. There is no alert when it's done, but the little light on the side goes out. I found it much easier than leaving the typical kettle on the stove. The kettle on the stove constantly had to be cleaned because of food splatters from normal cooking. The extra cord wraps neatly in the base. Best of all, the handle is cool enough to pick up with your bare hand. Also, the water doesn't want to splatter when you pour. This kettle is a bit smaller than the usual 2 liter kettle. In other words, it heats 1.3 quarts. If that's enough for you, go for it.

Purchased this kettle to heat water to brew coffee in a french press. The kettle is well made although the removable top is made of thin aluminum and heats quickly. I like the fact that it has an automatic shut off once the water reaches boiling temperature. The interior of the kettle also has a maximum water level marker that is a nice feature. I have been pleased with how quickly it brings water to boil. Overall, I am very satisfied with this kettle.

reviews.reviewTitle: Must have if you're in the market for an electric kettle
reviews.reviewText: I bought this for my wife over a year ago when she got pregnant and she wanted to transition from coffee to herbal, caffeine-fee tea in the morning. This electric kettle is amazing and we both use it daily. I have transitioned to using a french press for coffee in the morning and this is so much quicker than using a drip coffee maker. The water heats up to boiling in about a minute which saves so much time when compared to heating water on the stove as we were doing before. My wife loves the color as it matches her other KitchenAid gadgets and meets the standard high quality you can expect from this brand. It hasn't been scratched or dinged at all and is very easy to clean. 1.25 liter volume is just right for the 2 of us. Also, it seems pretty safe considering neither of us have burned ourselves.

Heats up quickly, but noisily - I actually like the noise, because I can tell how close the water is to boiling. It is easy to pour from when it's at least half full. When there is less water, it's a little awkward. I have to hold the handle from the back rather than the middle. The spout filter slips out for easy cleaning. I'm looking forward to many cups of tea!

reviews.reviewTitle: In daily service for almost a year, no problems
reviews.reviewText: This is our second of these kettles - my mother took the first one for her apartment! We've had this kettle since April 2018 (almost a year as of this writing) and we use it at least once a day. No rust, no leaks, no switch failure. It has no manual temperature control, but it shuts off quickly after reaching a rolling boil so the thermostat must be pretty accurate. I cannot evaluate the energy efficiency without measuring the current draw and comparing that to other kettles, which I won't be doing any time soon.

This is another gift I bought for my nieces’ wedding. She absolutely loves it. Heats up quick and it beats using the stove or microwave. Plus, the color is a beautiful pistachio. Love the color options.

reviews.reviewTitle: Looks really nice. 1.5ft power cable though.
reviews.reviewText: This kettle works well and is quick to heat water. Also it is very stylish. My only problem and the reason I'm giving this 4 out of 5 stars instead of the full 5 is due to the very short power cable. For some people they probably prefer a shorter cable if keeping the kettle right next to the plugs, but for my situation, I have cabinets that are above the plugs and the 1.5ft cable is just way too short. Almost worth finding a discrete extension for the cable.

reviews.reviewTitle: Boiled water tastes like plastic. Don't buy.
reviews.reviewText: I really want to like this kettle as it looks so cute. The color is beautiful, too. However, none of that matters if the plastic filter inside the kettle is unremovable. The plastic is in contact with, in fact, soaked in the water when there's max amount of water in the kettle. The boiled water has a strong plastic taste that you can't ignore, even days after use. I'm returning it.

reviews.reviewTitle: sturdy construction. I'd give it a 5

reviews.reviewTitle: A stylish and well made kettle, with some minor drawbacks
reviews.reviewText:
All in all, a great little kettle, with a couple minor drawbacks to note.

Pros:
Fast boiling time
Small footprint is great for more crowded counters like mine
Appealing "modern but retro" design
Convenient cord storage
Well made and sturdy, in line with typical KitchenAid products in terms of quality

Cons:
Smaller water volume than many other kettles
No way to see water level without opening the pot - I thought this wouldn't bother me, but it turns out I've come to rely on that feature
Pricier than many other stainless steel models
Plastic filter assembly on the interior makes for a stainless steel kettle that is not fully stainless steel

For those worried about the plastic:
You can remove it entirely. To do so, you will need a pair of short-handled pliers, small enough to fit inside the kettle. First, slide out the filter itself by pulling upward. This will take out the filter panel, leaving the plastic filter mounting assembly. In order to remove this, you will need to look inside to locate a small stainless steel protrusion in the center of the assembly. Notice that it has been twisted in order to secure the plastic. Grasp it with your pliers, and turn, straightening out the protrusion, and releasing the plastic assembly frame. You may have to wiggle the frame a bit to get it to release. Please note that you may find that this job requires small hands - the interior of the kettle is not very roomy, and I had a hard time getting operating inside of it with the pliers.

reviews.reviewText: Pours Great, Looks Great and color is GORGEOUS! It also heats up fast. We use our electric kettles A LOT! With more than 10 people in our household we get to understand very quickly if something is going to work or not work and even hold up to heavy use. So far, 2 months in, this is working out marvelously. There was some "plastic" smell the first couple of times we used it, but we simply kept boiling water and dumping it. This was quickly a non issue, and no "plastic" smell or tastes at all now. Did I mention the color is Gorgeous, and with a quick wipe down it looks new again (not always the case with stainless products). Has excellent pouring accuracy, which is important when you make your coffee with a cone or you have children using it to make their tea. Most our tea kettles die around the 1 year mark for any number of reasons, this is always a bummer! But we do use things heavily around here, so I have come to except that. This is a beautifully designed, well made, back to basics kettle. I feel quite privileged to have something so elegant in my kitchen.
It is a no nonsense kettle: you put water in it, return it to its base, push a little lever down, and it boils your water (with a discreet white light near the switch to tell you it's working), clicking when it's done. No Internet connection required, no fancy filters to change, no voice control or annoying beeps. It's a kettle, pure and simple, which is all it needs to be.
The only issue I can think of is that it may be a little small for some people. It's only 1.25 liters (just over two and a half U.S. Pints).

This kettle is perfect for our needs. Quite simple to use and lovely to look at. An excellent design feature is that Kitchen Aid put the electrical connection at the center of the base so the kettle makes a solid connection no matter how it is rotated, no fumbling about setting the kettle on its base. A full kettle takes a little over 5 minutes to boil, not the fastest but not too bad either. No buzzers or beeps either like some other models. It has one switch that you depress to turn in on that will flip itself off when the water's hot. Did I mention it was simple?

If you are looking for a quality "uncomplicated" kettle this may be the one for you. Also be aware this kettle's metal surfaces get HOT except for the handle, so use with care.

reviews.reviewTitle: Pretty Electric Kettle- 1500 Watts - Some Plastic Inside
reviews.reviewText:
This is a pretty electric kettle with some plastic inside.

-It heats water quickly - 1500 watts.
- Has an easy flipper on/off switch that lights up when it's on.
-360 degree rotation on its base.
-Small size 1.25 liter = 1.32 Quart.
-Has a removable lime scale filter - this is where the plastic problem enters the pot design.
-Water pours well without making a drippy mess.
-Has Auto Off - turns itself off when it hits a boil.
-No keep warm function.

There is plastic inside. The plastic filter is removable but the attachment piece is plastic & is still there after you remove the filter. It is at the spout so water does pass over it every time you pour. I do not know if the plastic is BPA free - I would hope so. I always get rid of these filters when they come with an electric filter so I see no benefit to even providing them. There are 2 plastic rivets that hold the handle to the lid - they should not pose any problem because they are not in contact with water.

If you have hard water as I do, you will need to descale this kettle occasionally. I just pour a cup of white vinegar in, let it sit for 15 minutes or so & then use a bottle brush to gently scrub & rinse it away.

There are no measuring marks or window so you have to guess at the amount of water. That does not work for me because I mainly use this kettle for making pour over coffee in to a stainless carafe & I need a specific amount of water to coffee bean ratio. So I have to get out a measuring cup to do this properly. I will need to make a scratch on the inside to mark the proper water line amount.

As with many KA products these days, a lot of thought goes in to how pretty the appliance is & not the overall usefulness/quality.

reviews.reviewTitle: Can't be healthy and certainly not enjoyable...
reviews.reviewText:
One point for appearance, very nice looking. One point off for being made in China (yes, it matters). Bottom line, is tried using mine daily for almost two months. Due to plastic part inside kettle (I suppose), makes tea that tastes like a brand new garden hose...like plastic. Also tastes like burnt metal...as if a pot was left empty on stove to heat up to burning, then water was added, heated, and used to make tea. Tea was dark and murky with film/residue on top. Did several experiments using same (RO Filtered) water, where I made tea from this kettle, and tea from water heated in microwave. Came out the same every time, the tea from the microwave clear, and delicious and tasting only of tea, and from this kettle, as described above. Also, unit smells very strong of burning wire. After two solid months, none of the conditions improved.
The cord on the base unit comes out of the box VERY short. Took some days to figure out that the cord is winded inside the base. There is no mention of this in the instructions. Wish I had returned immediately, and definitely do not recommend. This kettle is going to the e-waste pile.

reviews.reviewText: We've had this for a couple of weeks and have found it to be very efficient as well as stylish. It heats quickly which is nice if you make tea - or hot chocolate or even coffee - by the cup. It sits pretty on the counter and we've used it quite regularly with no problems. If you've used one of these, you'll find this instantly familiar. In fact, it's design - and functionality - is pretty similar to others we've used. Which is why I've given it four stars instead of five. It IS the most stylish electric kettle on the market but the price reflects that. If you want stylish, know this is a good one. If you want funcationality, our experience is there are other, less expensive models with the same features. I've seen some complaints about plastic inside. Most of them have that. Not a big deal for us.

reviews.reviewTitle: Paying A Premium For A Brand Badge, Not A Difference
reviews.reviewText:
Compared to other electric water kettles I've owned, I found the KitchenAid kettle the most attractive of all and at least as fast, or faster, boiling water. The only significant difference I found between the KitchenAid kettle and my favorite, the Aroma Hot H20 X-Press 1.5 Liter (6-Cup) Cordless Electric Water Kettle, Stainless Steel, was the price.

I'd recommend the Aroma more. It compares in all the important ways (cordless, 360 degree rotation, mainly stainless interior, heats really fast, auto off), plus it's bigger and has a water level indicator. I find the KitchenAid's retro design and almost-all-stainless exterior more attactive, but I'm more interested in performance and bang for my buck. Plus, there's something I really dislike about that big ol' name badge on the front that screams "KITCHENAID!"

There is less interior plastic in the KitchenAid than in the Aroma, but not much less, and the fact remains that the KitchenAid still has plastic. If the inside was retooled to replace the plastic bits with stainless, I'd rate the improved product 5 stars for the same price.

If you're buying a gift for a person more concience of brand names than value or performance, get the KitchenAid. Otherwise, buy two Aromas for the price of one KitchenAid and make two people happy.

reviews.reviewTitle: A Fine Product with One Flaw
reviews.reviewText: This is a classic-looking kettle that heats water quickly and automatically turns off when the water is hot. One flaw is that the handle at the top of the kettle doesn't swivel out of the way. As a result, it's a little tricky to fill with water and if for some reason you need to remove the lid while the water is hot, you're in danger of getting a steam burn. An unfortunate flaw in an otherwise fine item.

I bought this kettle in black a couple of years ago. It's still going strong. No rust, heats water fast, auto shut-off that has never failed. And I love the smaller capacity. To me, it's the perfect electric kettle.
It broke after 2 month of use. it would not turn off when water starts boiling...

This thing worked like a dream. Boiled water about 3-4 times a day. Looks like it is beginning to rust on the bottom. Suddenly stopped working - no connection between base and kettle. Cannot take apart and fix (triangle Robertson screws?). No warranty or replacement option from Kitchenaid. Shame. Not worth $60 for 6 months of service.

I am married to a Brit and so know that most countries have been using electric kettles since at least the 70’s while they have only recently become popular in the USA. I remember trying to buy my first electric kettle here in the USA and the lady at Macy’s looking quite appalled and showing me all their coffee machines.

I’ve had about three electric kettles in the 16 years since that episode and now they are as common and easy to find as stove top kettles.

This KitchenAid kettle has a traditional retro design influence that suits our modernized 50’s style kitchen well. It holds 1.25 liters of water which comes to approximately 10 coffee cups. It sits on a round plastic base that has basic cord management so you can adjust the length so it reaches between 1.5 and 3.5 feet.

It’s made of a mix of brushed steel with polished steel lid and accents. The heating element is concealed so the inside of the pot is bare clean and smooth and easy to clean. There is minimal plastic inside; just the sliding removable gauze filter and mounting frame are made of plastic.

This kettle is surprisingly light when empty compared to the Krups I have been using. It weighs almost nothing.

Controls are simple, just the single button at the bottom rear of the kettle. You push it down and a LED lights up to tell you it’s on. The thermostat inside turns the kettle off automatically when the water is boiled. There is no water meter, you lift the lid and fill. A small metal prong poked out from the inside rear of the pot about 2/3 of the way up and is the max water limit marker.

I timed the kettle to boil cold tap water filled to the max marker. It took exactly 5 minutes and 45 seconds to boil the 42oz of water. My Krups kettle is slight larger and holds 60oz and takes 7 minutes 15 seconds to boil. So this seems pretty reasonable.

One thing I did notice is that this KitchenAid kettle is quiet. The initial 3 minutes were silent and I was concerned that it wasn’t working properly and might take a long time. The usual metallic kettle hiss began after 3 minutes as the water began to boil. So this is definitely the quietest kettle I have used.

Overall it’s a simple to use kettle with an attractive design that boils water in good time. Inside there is minimal plastic while a gauze filter prevents any solid matter in your water getting poured into your cup. I recommend it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good basic kettle for not so basic price
reviews.reviewText:
I drink tea a few times a day, so I buy kettles often and very familiar with products out there + best in class features.

I call this kettle basic, because it lacks features of high end kettles, for honestly about same price. It's missing the water temperature setting, the keep warm setting, the water level indicator, the proper whistle when water is boiling. Btw, I hate when these things actually boil water - it's way too hot to drink - I prefer 189 to 193 degrees - not full 200+. Why is the power cord so short? And, as others mentioned, it has plastic inside of it.

On the plus side, this kettle is gorgeous! I'm proud to have it in my kitchen. It boils water rapidly - love it! Overall, I'd say buy it for looks and fast operation, not for it's features.

reviews.reviewTitle: I love this! Perfect size and boils pretty fast
reviews.reviewText: I love this ! Perfect size and boils pretty fast ! Beautiful color. No issues at all for 2 years now. I’ve given them as Christmas presents and the recipients love them !
I've had this for a few years now and it's absolutely perfect. It's just the right size for a few cups. I use it almost daily and it's held up extremely well.

Love this kettle. I was on the market for it for over a year as it's impossible to find it for a reasonable price in Canada. I finally made it to the States and picked one up and I am so glad I did. It looks as great as it does in the pictures. The only reason I'm giving 4 stars is because the capacity is quite small so there is only enough water for two cups of tea or so.

reviews.reviewTitle: It really is remarkable how stupid electric kettle manufacturers are
reviews.reviewText: Dear Kitchenaid: It really is remarkable how stupid electric kettle manufacturers are. You take a beautiful functional kettle like you've designed and insert a plastic bracket inside that cannot be removed and that dips into the water as it boils so that plastic can leach into our tea. Has anyone at any electric kettle manufacturer bothered to read the literally hundreds of reviews on Amazon complaining how electric kettles all have plastic inside of them? We want an all stainless kettle at least on the inside. And none of you seem bright enough to recognize the market potential here. At the very least if you are salivating over the idea of having some plastic parts inside the kettle at least make them removable so those of us who dislike toxins in our blood can remove that plastic if we choose. I must now return this gorgeous looking kettle to find another one.
As per other reviewers, rusted after a year at bottom joint. Never had this issue before on other kettles. Will never buy this brand again. Premium price and it`s just not worth it.
Love this Kettle!
It looks stylish and works quiet. The size fits for small family, buy bigger if you need more than 3 cups for a time
I love this product. Fab colour. Easy to use.
Love it!!!
Looks great, and works well.
Just love it!!!
Perfect!

reviews.reviewTitle: Worked very nicely for 15 months and then the flimsy-seeming plastic switch ...
reviews.reviewText: Worked very nicely for 15 months and then the flimsy-seeming plastic switch I always mistrusted stopped working and now the thing won't turn on. Lame.

reviews.reviewTitle: Stylish compact kettle, but the switch feels soft
reviews.reviewText: Very nice compact electric kettle. Stylish stainless steel. The handle on top is easier on the wrist than a side mounted handle. My only complaint is the switch is smaller and feels rather soft compared to other electric kettles that I have owned. I am able to fill this kettle from my refrig water dispenser through the spout. There is no external fill indicator. You have to remove the lid and look down to see then the water level touches the MAX fill rod. I would purchase again.

reviews.reviewTitle: Disappointed that it lasted only a year and half
reviews.reviewText: I purchased this kettle because it looked cute and different from other electric kettle even though it was more expensive. After using this only a year and half, it stopped working recently. I was disappointed that it lasted only such a short time. As I used it daily, I realized it was too small and I wanted to purchase one that holds more water so I bought SECURA Original Stainless Steel Double Wall electric kettle later on because it holds more water, all stainless steel and cheaper and had even better reviews than KitchenAid. I was going to give KitchenAid electric kettle to my daughter who lives in a dorm but she said she didn't need it so when it stopped working, I started using SECURA electric kettle and I am very happy with it so far. I learned the lesson not to be fooled by how it looks.

Beautiful kettle & I wanted so badly to keep it, but there is a large piece of plastic surrounding the spout on the inside where it would sit in the hot/boiling water. I purchased a different kettle that is 100% stainless steel inside. Not cute like this one but safer.

since my 10 year old electric kettle needed to be replaced, I looked for another one that would not have any plastic touching the hot water at least on the inside.

This Kitchen Aid kettle has a pretty design (bought the red) and the interior is made of stainless steel.
PROS:
1.Stainless Steel interior (except for the plastic part that also exists inside as well)
2.pretty, retro design
3.simple on/off function

However, these cons made me to decide to return it even before using it:
CONS:
1.big plastic part that cannot be removed on the inside (top to bottom; so the hot water will touch it)
2.filter can be removed but is made of plastic
3.the handle on top + the small opening of lid: hard to clean the inside; the handle gets in my way when I want to
pour in water. I wish the handle could be moved to the side or something

I returned it because of the plastic part that would touch hot water;
I would recommend it to those who like the looks rather than being picky about materials.
I probably would have kept the kettle if the handle, plastic parts were better placed.

overall: 3/5

reviews.reviewTitle: If fortuitously the replacement does not foul the water
reviews.reviewText: This Kitchenaid has a strong metallic/chemical odor that is imparted to the boiled water. Have boiled two pots of water every day for the past two weeks, and the off odor/taste is still present. Have used stainless electric tea kettles for decades, this is the first one that has a manufactured smell/taste that does not go away quickly. Nothing else has changed in our plumbing or water supply - clean, pure tasting well water. Contacted Amazon support. They are sending a replacement. If fortuitously the replacement does not foul the water, then I will give more stars.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very nice ... great find after looking for a long time.
reviews.reviewText:
Hard to find what we wanted. We have a very contemporary kitchen and most hot water pots are a bit, well, weird looking. We did not want glass as we have one at the office and it loses its heat quickly. Took a chance having never seen the KitchenAid unit and when it arrived I wasn't sure. However after setting up and placing in kitchen it looked perfect and modern enough to fit in.

The size is perfect for a couple ...

How it works is like you'd expect. It heats quickly and keep the water warm for some time. My only problem with the unit is I have rather large hands and trying to get the lid on and off is kind of a contortionist trick.

reviews.reviewTitle: Plastic filter housing is big and not removable.
reviews.reviewText: Based on reviews I read, I thought the plastic filter n housing would be easily removable. The filter slides out, so no problem. But the filter housing was not easy and was big. In the process of removing it, I ended up breaking the piece. Hence the tea pot is not usable. I ended up buying a different one without any plastic parts. Reviews weren't helpful and were misleading.

reviews.reviewTitle: Gets My Water Hot, Looks Good Doing It
reviews.reviewText:
I like this kettle, but mostly because it is pretty. It boils water quickly, and it has a pleasant heft to it. I bought it to replace a less expensive model that had a larger capacity, and that you could select tempuratures on. But, it was never pretty. Maybe I am shallow. I can wait a couple minutes for the water to cool to 205° for coffee.

Also, fewer functions and a sturdier build mean that I expect this kettle to last a long time.

After going through three Ovente kettles in around two years time, I am thrilled to have purchased a much higher quality product. Yes there's a bit of plastic but it's not where the water boils, and judging from the high quality of the stainless steel I'm sure the plastic they used is safe too. Only one temperature setting and you can't see the water, I don't care I'm thrilled with this product. I even ordered one of their black kitchen timers to match. Kitchenaid has never disappointed me!

I ordinarily do not leave feedback, but in this circumstance, I felt it was warranted. I love this kettle but I have now gone through two of them in a year in a half. Both kettles just stopped working. I took a chance on purchasing a second one after the first one stopped working. Fool me twice, shame on me. Too bad, because I love the style and ordinarily have been successful with Kitchen Aid brand....until now.

It has no water level indicator. Requires both hands as the lid has to be removed to check the level and/or filling up, then the handle is fixed and in the way of the small opening. Also in real life it's just too shiny and too plastic to look retro, for example the metal lid has a gratitious cutout with a black plastic disc insert in the center.
We kept it because my wife loves the green color.

I returned immediately after trying to use. The cords only about 12" long and very stiff. It is so short that it sticks out from the wall before heading downward which is right next to kettle. Stupid design. You cant even pull the kettle off of the element without touching the cord with your hand or kettle. Were they trying to save money on cords cause you would have no choice but to let it sit about 6" out onto your counter exactly in front of the wall outlet. You cant push it closer because of cord and if you put cord to side, it is unsightly and in way. Defective design in my opinion.

reviews.reviewTitle: The rare kettle that's not an eye sore
reviews.reviewText:
Summary: I was sufficiently in love with this kettle that when our new au pair (who had never encountered an electric kettle) melted the bottom by trying to heat this thing on our gas stove, my husband immediately ordered a replacement because he knew I'd be heart broken.

I bought this kettle because I wanted a stainless steel one that matches my red kitchen aid stand mixer. It's amazing. Easy to use and made with high quality materials. Most kettles are enormous, plastic monstrosities that you'd want to hide in a cupboard. This thing earns a spot on the counter.

I’ve had this kettle for over 2 years and use it 4-5 times a day. I never empty it between uses and most of the time just add more till the next morning when I empty it and put fresh water in. I use vinegar to remove scale inside and on the lid about every 2 weeks because I live in Scottsdale AZ and we have very hard water. It’s simple to use, on/off, so very little to worry about electronically. I’ve never had a problem with it and I think it’s a great kettle and I’d buy it again.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not a bargain, but sturdy, attractive and worth the price.
reviews.reviewText: KitchenAid KEK1222PT 1.25-Liter Electric Kettle - Pistachio I purchased this to replace a worn out Bodum 1.7L electric kettle. This kettle is smaller and was more expensive, but is a pleasure to use. The kettle is metal, solidly built and attractive. It heats more slowly than the old kettle, but reasonably quickly. It's quieter than the Bodum was; hence, I don't always hear it turn off when the contents have reached boiling point. You're supposed to remove the lid to refill, but being lazy we just pour a stream of water from the faucet into the spout and wipe the pot dry before placing it on the base. The cord from the base to the power supply is intentionally short – only 14". That wasn't a problem for us, but is important to consider. We're very pleased with it.

This is by far the best teapot I have owned!!! It heats up quickly with not much noise. It is made of high quality materials that probably will last for years. No rust and I don’t empty it after each use but I do use filtered water. And aesthetically it is very nice and the color is great!!! I ordered the pistachio. I’m going to buy the stove top version next.

This kettle worked well for over two years. I didn’t have any problems with the looks or functionality, and it heats water very quickly.
Yesterday I noticed that my counter was flooded with water and there was a puddle of water on the floor. It looks like the bottom of the kettle melted, and some of the plastic was destroyed. We used this kettle once or twice a week for a couple years, and expected it to last for another ten years. Very disappointed as it was a pricey purchase.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great kettle at three years and counting
reviews.reviewText: I read tons of reviews before I bought this and am happy to report that three years later, it still works perfectly. No rust, no weird black residue, the switch is still fine and has not snapped off (even though it does seem like the most "fragile" part of the kettle) -- it's been a great kettle. Always love seeing it on my kitchen counter! The red is so cheerful. I've never washed out the inside, although I probably should. I live on the West Coast where our water is "soft," so be sure to check what type of water you have since that may influence what happens with rusting, etc. Would definitely buy again.

I really trust the KitchenAid brand, and really like the color of this kettle. That's why I bought this overpriced product. However, this product has a glaring flaw: the cord is too short. I think the cord must be maybe 3 feet long. We had to put it on an awkward spot on our counter for this reason. I would suggest to buy another product that has a longer and retractable cord. I am disappointed with this product for that reason.
As a hot water heater though, it is sufficient. I like this is completely metal so I don't have to worry about plastic getting into my water.
As easy as microwaving, as effective as a stove top kettle. If your a tea drinker. Make sure you stock up. You'll use this all the time. (my wife still thinks this was her christmas gift lol)

Bought for my mother. She loves it. Minimal plastic parts inside the boiler, which makes this safer to use than others (this was a key part of us choosing this product over others). The looks are classic and beautiful.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great product- Only wish spout was designed differently for my uses
reviews.reviewText: I’ve had the kettle in pistachio green for 2 years and it has been serving me well. I use this every single day. Originally, I bought the electric kettle when I was in college since I drink a lot of coffee and tea and didn’t have immediate access to a stove. I’ve kept it since it heats up water much faster than on the stove top. The only reason I gave it 4 stars is I’m starting to wish the spout design was more of a gooseneck shape since I’ve gotten into pour coffee. Other than that, I have no regrets and only positive things to say.

I have always wanted to get a electric tea kettle but really did not like the look of them. This one in pistachio looks beautiful on the counter. Heats quickly and quietly. I am grateful for the automatic shut off. Only complaint I have is I wish they did not have the plastic filter piece inside.

reviews.reviewTitle: I love this kettle with everything I have
reviews.reviewText: I use this kettle at least twice a day. I use hot water to soften my dog's food in the AM and PM, I drink a fair amount of instant coffee when I don't want to make a pot, and at night I like a cup of tea when I am making my dog's night time meal. I am super happy with this purchase.

reviews.reviewTitle: Loving it! And it's so cute, unlike most electric kettles on the market...
reviews.reviewText: I've been using this kettle for two months now and am so happy I bought it. It's so much faster than my traditional kettle, allowing me to have properly brewed tea every morning---not just on leisurely mornings. Quickly, I can make a couple mugs of tea plus a quart to chill for later. I should have bought this years ago! I've had no trouble with the kettle: it lives on my counter, and I treat it with care, drying the inside with a paper towel after every use to ward off any rust some of the other reviews are complaining about.

reviews.reviewTitle: I Am Looking For A Replacement After Three Months.
reviews.reviewText:
I'll be shopping for a new electric kettle, I'm sorry to say. I bought this after reading about lots and lots of different kettles. I was looking for one that was as close to 1 litre capacity or less as possible, lacked plastic parts contacting the heated water, and was made from stainless steel.
1) Some of the answers to questions here stated that although there was plastic in the device, it could be removed: IT CAN NOT!(the handle has to be removed to get the front part out, if it can be done at all).
2) Although this appears to be stainless steel, after less than three months there is a spot of rust developing between the bottom element and the sides which may explain...
3) I noticed a chemical smell immediately and assumed/hoped that this was from the enamel finish on the outside of the pot and expected it to go away with time. Unfortunately, the smell has remained, although diminished, and I believe that it affects the flavour of the water and this gives me the heebie jeebies.
I am looking for a different device.
I would rate this one star except that it does boil the water well and the size is about right. Very disappointed that this relatively expensive device has so many issues, especially the smell/taste thing.

Boils water about twice as fast as a kettle on the gas range, and we use a commercial gas range with lots of BTU's.
As others reviewers have detailed if water is kept at or below the max fill line, the water does not come in contact with the plastic filter parts.
4 cups of water will bring you just below the max fill line. Haven't used the range to boil water since we got this!

Purchased in Dec 2017. Electric tea pot stopped working in April 2018 - no reason, unexplainable. Won’t operate or heat up any longer.
Lasted about 5 months.

reviews.reviewTitle: heavy, sturdy, very little plastic inside
reviews.reviewText: I don't need the water from this to hit a certain temperature so it's never been an issue. probably if I were making specialized teas, I would really care that it can't do that. I love the color and that it's sturdy since my elder care folks tend to drop the kettle from time to time. It can at times be too heavy for them to pickup and lift.
Metallic taste after several uses. Suggestions? I like this cute pot, though it is easy to get burned on the lid.

reviews.reviewTitle: If your main priority is cute + functional this will work
reviews.reviewText: Cute but not as functional as others. I have purchased other electric kettles that heat up the water waaaaay faster. This takes about 5-8 mins to get to boiling. It’s ok, using it in the rv.
Stainless steel with non removable plastic parts inside touching the water. What’s the point then? It’s widely known that heating plastic is toxic. Pissed off.

reviews.reviewTitle: Fantastic water boiler, no bells! Just works!! Buy it!
reviews.reviewText: I know there are bad reviews but I love it. No defects. No problems. Better than the new design because it is simpler. Simple is better. Color is perfect. I have one at home and one at the office. Boils water quickly. No alarms no bells, no whistles...just boils water in a big. Fantastic!
Everything “spot on” until viewing inside - big chunk black plastic permanently attached. Leeching when exposed to hot/boiling water a valid concern. Please redesign and I will be happy to order.

reviews.reviewTitle: has a weird smell after 3 month usage
reviews.reviewText: i like how it looks and goes very well in my kitchen. it is a little small, but that is not the reason for my 3 star review. It s small really bad after using is for over 3 month now. I had this problem before but it would go away after a week or so. or I would boil water with baking soda and that will do. But this one is just smells bad.

reviews.reviewTitle: Well made with nice colors to choose from
reviews.reviewText: I received this as a gift 2 years ago. I ABSOLUTELY Love my tea pot as I normally drink 1~2 cups of tea a day. This is an absolute great buy and last a long time~ KitchenAid is the BEST appliances ever!!! I have a older stand 6 qt. mixer that I've had for 25 years and still running strong!!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Durable and reliable hot water kettle
reviews.reviewText: I’ve been using this kettle daily for almost two years now. Still works well and looks great. Over time (in our area) you start to see hard water buildup on the base, but it looks brand new after pouring in some vinegar and letting it sit for a couple hours.

I absolutely love this electric kettle! It heats the water extremely fast and very quietly, and shuts off automatically when
the water boils. The cord is short for safety reasons. It looks lovely on the counter top and matches my KA mixer! I much prefer using it to the
microwave because your mug handle doesn't get hot and in my case, the kettle doesn't knock our computer off line like the microwave does!

I love this so far. It's compact, stylish, functional, heats up my tea water very quickly and looks great on the counter in my new kitchen. I was happy to find you can extend the cord to the plug a little - additional cord is coiled under the unit. The light kiwi color is very pretty. I love Kitchenaid products and so far this one is as exceptional as the others I own.
Great little teakettle. High quality exterior, heats super fast and is stable on the base.

reviews.reviewTitle: Nice and simple. Great for office.
reviews.reviewText: I keep mine in my office at work. Love the simple mechanics (not everything needs screen or flashing lights). Holds more water than I thought it would. Can be pricey, but keep checking online. I got mine on sale after Christmas for 40% off.

My favorite water heater. Stainless steal inside. No hot handle like the stove top kettles and it doesn't get filthy from cooking splatter. Shuts off
when water is boiled so no need to wait around to babysit it.
***UPDATE, WORKED great until the warranty ran out at one year!

Bought this after buying a cheaper one that came not working. So glad I did. Heats water so quickly, and looks super slick. Only issues I've had is I burned my hand when trying to make multiple pots of hot water in a row, taking the top off and holding it from the top loop at the same time gets tricky.

I have an electric kettle at work and after years, thought... why don't we have one at home??? looked at the reviews and opted for this one. Love the color and has been working perfectly (knock wood). We use it daily and sometimes 2 x a day. Recommend!

What a neat little kettle! Heats up VERY quickly, automatic shutoff works great, simple cleaning.

Makes a few strange noises, but no big deal. Very satisfied and highly recommend.

Looks great on the counter, the base cord folds and stores neatly, which is a big plus. In my opinion, most of the other electric kettles "look" like plastic pitchers, and I'm sure they work fine- but this one sort of looks like it belongs in a kitchen.

The kettle lasted just over one year. It seems as though a tiny spring holding the very delicate contacts in place may be fatiguing. Had the manufacturer had put a fraction of the care manufacturing the electrical contacts as they invested in their large logo it may have worked for years. Pretty to look at but not made to last.

I have had this teakettle about 6 months. I use it several times a day, everyday. I love it. It heats very quickly. It is pretty and stylish. A nice size for a single person to have several cups tea in a day without having to refill the pot.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great little kettle for daily tea and coffee
reviews.reviewText: Great little kettle for daily tea and coffee. It is both nice to look at and functional. If you want enough water to fill your China teapot get the larger version, but for quick cups of tea and coffee this one is wonderful and it turns off by itself...no worrying about not hearing a normal pot whistle.

Loved this product but the on off switch is to easy to break off. was totally disappointed that we had it such a short time before it did break off.
it was so cute and worked great.
This is the best tea kettle ever. Use it also to make coffee with the aero press.

Boils water extremely fast compared to stovetop boiling. It's getting much more use than I initial expected due to the speed. Love the simplicity, design, and color, though I'd prefer a handle that rotates.
Sturdy, high quality. We've had many of these electric kettles, and most of them die way too quickly. Worth the extra few dollars.

reviews.reviewTitle: Does not have a guage for the water
reviews.reviewText: Unfortunately, I did not notice that it did not have a gauge for the water so being careful to refill is important. Also the thickness of the structure is not up to the usual Kitchenaid standards. On the positive side it does boil quickly and the color is nice which fits in with my retro kitchen.
I love the look of this kettle! Boils enough water for 2 big cups of tea. Not as big as my old kettle that gave up the ghost but I prefer the vintage look of this.

This is such a pretty kettle and I wanted to love it, but I ended up returning it because it was incredibly noisy. It clanks and bangs and makes a quite extraordinary racket while it heats the water. Quite a to-do for just some hot water . . .

Absolutely love this product! Such a useful item that also looks beautiful in my kitchen. My husband and I use it every evening for tea and mention nearly every time what a great purchase it was. Hot water in seconds! You won’t be sorry😁

reviews.reviewTitle: It's hold the perfect amount of water and doesn't take up a lot of counter space.
reviews.reviewText: Use it almost everyday. Very clean look. It's hold the perfect amount of water and doesn't take up a lot of counter space. Water heats up much faster than heating a pot of water on the stove. The only thing missing is there's no warning bell or buzzer to let you know when it's done. So pay attention.
I bought one of these as a gift. My parents love it. The shape makes it easy to pour the hot liquid without tipping the kettle far over to empty it. It is well constructed.

reviews.reviewTitle: Was a gift for my mother who is like the biggest tea junkie ever
reviews.reviewText: Was a gift for my mother who is like the biggest tea junkie ever. She loves it. She turns it on and walks away and its just done in a few!

It was really loud. Louder than any other Kettle we’ve had. Really stylish and retro
Looking. Wished it had worked out.

I had previously owned one plastic kettle and two glass ones (including a Caprese). All 3 broke. This one is very well built, boils water in about 3 minutes and looks great on my countertop. Love. It.

reviews.reviewTitle: Nice design and looks great on the counter.
reviews.reviewText: We use this for making coffee (French press) and oatmeal in the morning. Extremely easy to use and has held up well!

Perfect !!!
I'm British I grew up with a
electric tea kettle I Love It !!!
The colour is amazing !! It matches our backsplash perfect !!!
Highly recommend 👍
I got this as a surprise for my mom, and it is a delightful kettle. Mom says, "totally awesome, I love it!". And we do! Easy to use, heats up in a jiffy, and nice safe short cord.
Stopped working after only a few months

reviews.reviewTitle: KITCHENAid makes a GREAT product. The color is RICH and VIVID
reviews.reviewText: KITCHENAid makes a GREAT product. The color is RICH and VIVID. The heating time is short. The operation is clear and easy. Water stays hot for along time once heated. I wish I could find other KITCHENAid products in this color. . . .

reviews.reviewTitle: loud wishling noise as water heats up
reviews.reviewText: message to seller, excellent kettle after 1 1/2 hr the kettle makes a really loud whistling noise as the water heats up. what's going on?
My wife loves this, uses it daily and it is dependable, temp controlled, and easy to pour. perfect.

reviews.reviewTitle: Just get it it’s a game changer.
reviews.reviewText: Our tenants introduced us to an electric kettle and we got addicted to it. Love it plus the red one looks cute and matches our kitchen.
Super cute, heats water fast, minimal contact with plastic (but there is a little, not enough that I'm worried about it). Works great and looks cute on the counter!
I really like this tea kettle. Heats water so much quicker than my glass top stove. Easy to clean and looks great on my counter top. So glad I purchased.
Good product!

reviews.reviewTitle: LOVE LOVE LOVE This little kettle
reviews.reviewText:
LOVE LOVE LOVE This little kettle! It is perfect and I was shocked at how quickly it boiled water and kept it hot!
Very stylish looking, but then I am partial to KitchenAid would highly recommend.

The other reviews showing "rust" are actually showing scaling. All kettles get scaling, but it is more visible in this kettle because it is easy to see the bottom.

To remove the scaling, boil vinegar and allow it to cool. Then wipe out any remaining brown spots.

reviews.reviewTitle: Always wanted a pot this sexy
reviews.reviewText: Love this! Discovered these in Europe at a hostel and had to have one. Not as quick as the 210 pot over there but great for making French press coffee or tea!

reviews.reviewTitle: Beautiful quality, quick boil easy to clean
reviews.reviewText: Kitchen aid has never let me down. This was a gift for my mother who is a tea drinker (afternoon tea at 3). Beautiful quality, quick boil easy to clean.
this is all stainless steel - perfect size - great value could not get any better
This kettle is adorable but stopped working after 6 months of use.

Love, Love, Love this tea kettle! The color is just as cute in person. It boils water super fast. My tips to those that posted about rusting are: 1) empty the pot completely after each boil 2) leave the top off or tilted after use so the inside may dry.
This is very efficient and looks so cute on my kitchen counter!!
Very nice and well made. Just the right sized pot for a couple cups of your favorite hot drink.

UPDATE REVIEW JANUARY 14TH 2017
===============================
Well, here I am, a year and half after my purchase, feeling heart broken.. The kettle fails on me!!!!
IT JUST STOP WORKING!!!!! The LED lights still on and everything. But it just don't want to boil anymore. And it happened so suddenly in a cold cold evening where one was really beat and looking for comfort from a nice cuppa tea!!! Never had I abuse you from over boilings nor dipping you in pool of water!
KITCHEN AID, I AM UPSET AT YOU!!! Why your life is so short? I was thinking to spend my whole life with you!!! I had treated you ever so gently! And not to mentioned its been a long time since I closed one eye on your chipped paint on your lid! And your noisy sounds while boiling since many months ago???
Anyway... Goodbye my kettle.. Thank you for stopping by in my life... I hope you find peace elsewhere...
And.. Am I gonna purchase your twin sisters?
I might need to heal my heart ache first!

reviews.reviewTitle: Love It Except for the Ugly Label on the Power Cord.
reviews.reviewText: I love the electric kettle. It looks nice and heats water more quickly than my old electric kettle. I took off a point because of the large, ugly warning label on the power cord, approximately 6" x 2.5", warning in 3 languages that there could be a shock hazard if it was not plugged into a 3 prong outlet. Granted, it is probably required by law. But they used the worst, stickiest, glue to attach it to the cable. It took me a good 20 minutes, and several chemicals to clean that goop off of the cable. Goo Gone wouldn't touch it. Gluing something that securely onto an item to be used in the kitchen should be illegal. Most electric cords come with warning labels, but most are less obnoxious and much easier to remove.

reviews.reviewTitle: Colorful, cute, sturdy and convenient kettle.
reviews.reviewText: I was skeptical about getting this electric water kettle because I wasn't sure how convenient it would be compared to my Zojirushi hot water dispenser. I like being able to have hot water available anytime I wanted and I didn't want to wait for the water to boil each time I needed some. My husband insisted that this kettle would be a lot safer because it isn't coated with plastic and hot water isn't just sitting in there for hours or even days. So, reluctantly I gave it a try and now I'm in love with this. If you only need a cup or two or hot water at a time, it takes literally less than a minute for it to start boiling. It takes less space, looks good and comes in bright cheerful colors. It's not a very big pot and is pretty pricey for it's size but it is convenient and a healthier option to the hot water dispensers. I highly recommend this.
